titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Its Records, 1939-1997 and undated, at the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library
titlestmt.author: A. Ramirez

address.addressline: The Southwest Collection/ Special Collections Library

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the National Collegiate Athletic Association Records, 1939-1997 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: National Collegiate Athletic Association Records, 1939-1997 and undated
did.abstract: The NCAA supports collegiate programs from all universities and colleges whose departments comply with NCAA regulations.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

did.physdesc: 13 boxes, 6 newspaper boxes and 9 binders (43 linear feet)

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: The NCAA is a nation-wide athletic organization set up to monitor athletic programs from collegiate schools. They monitor the schools' compliance, student, media relations, recruiting, sports, officiating, and championship regulations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of printed material of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) such as manuals, convention material, annual reports, yearbooks, directories, committee handbooks, historic and descriptive documents, studies, surveys, analyses, recruiting, compliance, student athlete information, faculty information, media relations, championships, baseball, basketball, football, golf, swimming and diving, tennis, track and field, volleyball, and periodicals.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Organizations)
controlaccess.corpname: National Collegiate Athletic Association--Handbooks, manuals, etc.
National Collegiate Athletic Association--Rules and practice

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: National Collegiate Athletic Association Records, 1939-1997 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

bibliography.head: Additional Sources
bibliography.bibref: Audette, Daniel Neil. The Effects of Title IX Legislation and Regulations on the Administration of Intercollegiate Athletic Programs for Schools in Divisions I, II, and III of the NCAA. [microform] Thesis (Ed. D.)--West Virginia University, 1982.

relatedmaterial.p: For related materials located in the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, see the following collections:

list.item: Dick Risenhoover oral history interview [sound recording], 1976
